context_bundle.summary: Grid-based movement and positioning tactics for Robot Rumble. Covers pathfinding algorithms, formation patterns, zone control, flanking maneuvers, and spatial dominance strategies for multi-robot coordination.

onboarding.quick_start: Control the center, maintain unit spacing, use walls as cover. Manhattan distance = |x1-x2| + |y1-y2|. BFS for pathfinding. Avoid clustering (splash damage risk).
common_patterns: Center control: Move toward grid center early game
Spread formation: Keep 2-3 cells between allies
Pincer movement: Flank from multiple directions
Wall hugging: Use edges to protect flanks
Retreat corridors: Plan escape routes before engaging

algorithms.targeting: Nearest enemy first or lowest HP

code_snippets.manhattan_distance: def dist(a, b): return abs(a.x - b.x) + abs(a.y - b.y)
code_snippets.move_toward: dx = sign(target.x - me.x); dy = sign(target.y - me.y)
